resources.string: Don\'t you have an account?Sign Up
Do you already have an account? Login
I have read the Declaration of Liability
Possession of a Green Pass (or non-EU equivalent)

Not to go to Sapienza University if I have tested positive for COVID-19. If I have tested positive, I will only go to Sapienza if I have received suitable medical certification, which I undertake to produce on request, showing that "negativisation occured" following the procedures laid down, issued by the local Dipartimento di Prevenzione or other health authority in charge;

-That I have carefully read the guidelines for students in the "COVID -19 Phase 3: Rules for students and external staff" document, available at https://www.uniroma1.it/en/pagina/airborne-infectious-diseases-italian (or VADEMECUM SULLE MISURE DI PREVENZIONE E PROTEZIONE PER LE ATTIVITA\' DI DIDATTICA IN PRESENZA - C 007 in Italian available at www.uniroma1.it/covid-sapienza) on the correct behaviour to observe during in-person educational activities to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and that I undertake to implement all the recommendations and procedures indicated;

-That I have carefully read the documentation published at https://www.uniroma1.it/en/node/202429 (or https://www.uniroma1.it/it/node/202429 in Italian) concerning the correct behaviour to be observed in Sapienza premises to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and that I undertake to implement all the recommendations and procedures indicated;

-That every day before going to class, I will check my health condition, making sure: \n I do not have a body temperature higher than 37.5 C° (or 99,5 °F); \n I do not have any flu-like symptoms that can be traced back to COVID-19 (cough, cold, sore throat, burning eyes, difficulty in breathing, acute smell or taste loss or altered sense of taste, etc.) and that I do not have any cohabitants with such symptoms; otherwise I undertake not to go to Sapienza;
-Not to go to Sapienza if I am subject to a period of compulsory isolation or quarantine, according to current government regulations.

-Not to go to Sapienza if I have tested positive for COVID-19. If I have tested positive, I will only go to Sapienza if I have received suitable medical certification, which I undertake to produce on request, showing that "negativisation occured" following the procedures laid down, issued by the local Dipartimento di Prevenzione or other health authority in charge;

string.u: You are already booked for that day and that room

resources.string: You need to allow the Location Permission in the settings
Classroom lesson bookings in the week 31/01/2022 - 05/02/2022 will be available from 24/01/2022 to 30/01/2022 for registration numbers with the last two digits between 00-99
